to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat

sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀使物价节节上涨。

sentences.english: But the friendship has been brilliant at times after losing ground.
sentences.chinese: 但友情却一直绚丽在时光节节败退后。

sentences.english: By the next year, the Bulls had started a winning streak.
sentences.chinese: 到第二年，芝加哥公牛队就开始了其节节胜利的战绩。

sentences.english: A sesame stalk puts forth blossoms notch by notch, higher and higher.
Consumer lending had pyramided since the war.
sentences.chinese: 战后消费者借贷节节上升。

sentences.english: After he won the first game, he never looked back.
sentences.chinese: 他胜了第一局后，就节节胜利。

sentences.english: Undoubtedly, moderate inflation can creep up to become high inflation.
sentences.chinese: 诚然，温和通胀会节节攀升，直至变为高通胀。

sentences.english: It is understood that there are three printed silk-like fabric sales rising.
sentences.chinese: 据了解，目前有三款印花仿真丝面料销量节节攀升。

sentences.english: Since the FPCC entered into the gasoline market, its profits have increased rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 台塑化自进入汽油市场以来，利润节节攀升。

sentences.english: But billable hours explain only part of the run-up in costs.
sentences.chinese: 但是收费时段只是费用节节攀高的部分原因所在。

sentences.english: When the free and easy defeated retreat, the only sensitive to the laughter.
sentences.chinese: 当洒脱溃不成军节节败退时，只剩下敏感在狂笑。

sentences.english: The nations that resist that alliance are in retreat.
sentences.chinese: 抵抗这个同盟的国家在节节败退。

sentences.english: So he began to edge toward the Dog, while the Dog backed away.
sentences.chinese: 于是他开始慢慢地向狗逼近，而狗则节节后退。

sentences.english: Sales of chocolate and running shoes are up.
sentences.chinese: 巧克力和跑鞋的销量节节攀升。
通货膨胀使物价节节上涨。

sentences.english: Afterward, he returned to the Imperial Starfleet and rose through the ranks.
sentences.chinese: 在此之后，他回到帝国星舰舰队并节节高升。
